text:
I took my car in & found out my clutch went out. I didn't have the $800 to $900 for the repairs, so I just went home. Ernie called me and said he could do the repair for $250 if I brought my own part. I bought the part, they replaced the clutch. They let me know the repair wasn't under warranty, but Ernie said to let him know if there were any issues.My clutch starts vibrating, which means they didn't align the flywheel and clutch properly. I called to let them know something was wrong. Alex said if they had to get into the car at all, I'd have to pay again. Yay, I get to pay out the ass again for something that wasn't done right in the first place. I guess it is my fault for not paying the $300 more to get the part through them... Oh wait, I don't have any money.

UPDATE:
Well, it's been less than six months since I got the clutch replaced. Thanks to their shoddy work, I now have to spend $1400 to replace my entire transmission and clutch. The repair place I went to asked who changed my clutch, because it is the reason my transmission was shot. Thanks for nothing!

text:
This is a long review, I hope you stick through it because it may help you decide on what makes a great mechanic versus a crappy one!

I had an air conditioner issue in the middle of summer.  Troy answered my call, was polite and extremely knowledgeable.  He was open to my input as I described the issue I had and was even patient with me as I tried to tell him more and more.  After calling around and getting hung up on I decided to call Jake's automotive back.  Troy answered and told me about the drop off overnight availability that they had there.

When I brought my car in on Sunday night to leave it, the car lot was full.  It was a good sign to me, showing that they had a lot of work.

Troy called me later that day to tell me what was wrong with my air conditioner.  He found a hole that punctured one of my lines and described the labor that was going to be involved.  I approved the order and he fixed it same day.  The shop closes at 5:30pm and he called me at 5:28pm letting me know it was ready for pick-up.

This sounds like a normal fix'r upper doesn't it?  Well, there is a reason why I have gone into so much detail.  Because it wasn't fixed.  I went in on Monday early evening and picked it up.  The A/C was working, but by the time I got home it was not.  I immediately called back and Troy answered the phone, clearly after they had closed.  He said he was working on something else and asked me to bring it back in.  He discovered that the charge of Freon in the system was too much.  He did not give any excuses, he just stayed late for me to drain it out and re-charge the Freon.  It was clearly a mistake, but it cost him, not me and I deeply appreciated the extra effort to make it right.  He could have just not answered the phone when I called him.

You see, I had a great mechanic before.  But he closed up shop when his dealership went out of business...and I had to find a new, honest mechanic.  Troy was GREAT and he has a customer for life!
prediction_reason: This is a detailed, genuine review describing the reviewer's specific experience with Jake's Automotive. The review provides concrete details about the air conditioning repair service, interactions with Troy (presumably a staff member), and the resolution of an issue. The 5-star rating aligns with the positive outcome and appreciation expressed for the mechanic's service. The content is highly relevant to an auto repair shop.
category: ['Auto repair shop', 'Auto tune up service', 'Oil change service']

text:
I arrived a little early and so fully expected to have to wait but after filling out a short form, standard release of responsibility, Austin took me right back and we got started. The salon is very clean and well appointed, I was given a sanitary towelette and a modesty drape and given a moment of privacy.
Austin was quick and as gentle as possible. When booking I was led to believe that the appointment for legs and bikini would take an hour and 15 minutes but I was pleasantly surprised to be in and out in less than 40.
The salon used a soft wax for the bikini area which is different than what I've had before but didn't seen to be as hot or painful if memory serves. I do have a couple of stragglers but that is more likely due to my hair than anything else. The one thing that I would say stuck out to me that I didn't really enjoy was a little lapse of privacy. The room that I was in is set up such that the table faces the door which opens onto a bright windowed hall which could potentially lead to a little awkward exposure.
Over all, I will be returning at least once more and then deciding from there.

text:
This place is awesome!  First, our server Britt was so energetic, friendly, and helpful. She gave us thoughtful opinions on our food options and she insisted upon giving us a free basket of chips for making us wait a little longer than usual to place orders (though it wasn't even that long!). Her customer service is top notch.

The food was delicious too.  We ordered the mango guacamole with chips and it was spicy, sweet, and fresh. The chips are killer. I ordered two turkey chorizo tacos that were flavorful and filled with just the right amount of contents--not messy!  My boyfriend got the mushroom tacos and grilled veggie tacos (vegetarian). The mushroom tacos had leeks and truffle oil in them and were SO SO GOOD.  The veggie tacos were so-so.  "They taste healthy," he said, and I agreed--take that for what it's worth.

We would definitely come back to this location in the future!

text:
This is the best RV park we have ever been.

The owners of Thousland Lakes RV Park are extremely friendly and helpful. They greeted us at the first night of arrival which contributed to a beautiful start to our long weekend getaway. The park in general has a very thoughtful layout. A green field in the middle of the park is surrounded by cabins, the tent sites and the RV parking lots. It resembles a meeting point and it is easy to make friends there (especially kids can roam around and play under the sight of their parents eyes). The pool is right next to it.

We stayed in a normal cabin over that weekend. Each cabin has its own fire pit, chairs&table inside as well as outside. The beds were comfortable and we had a beautiful view out of our back window.

The RV Park is meticulously clean and very well maintained. Visitors and staff are friendly and respectful. It was quiet at night even though plenty of kids were present during our visit. The RV park is conveniently close the national park, restaurants and a general store.

We have heard from friends complaining about WIFI which we personally did not use during our stay. The RV park offers Jeep rentals, a hair salon and a cute gift shop. We usually don't shop at gift shops but we found some beautiful things there (including a Christmas gift). I can highly recommend to visit the gift shop just because of the decorations, clothing and jewelry they sell there.

One improvement we can think of is the check-in process. Upon arrival, we have not received any information how the check-in procedure works. A recommendation here is, to send an info sheet along the confirmation email and put office/check-in hours on the website. The day of arrival, we tried to get a hold of the receptionist to receive more information about our check-in as we knew we would arrive after 10pm. We haven't heard anything back from them that day, neither via email or phone. Once we arrived, the reception was closed as expected. We found the trailer with the camp host who wasn't present and nobody answered the phone. After a while of looking around we saw little post-its with check in information on the door of the reception, so we could unlock the cabin by ourselves.
prediction_reason: This is a comprehensive, genuine review of an RV park experience. The reviewer provides detailed information about their stay, including specific aspects like the cabin, amenities, layout, cleanliness, and staff. The 5-star rating aligns with the overwhelmingly positive content, and the review includes both praise and constructive feedback about the check-in process, demonstrating authenticity.

text: As a newer property, the Alloy is undergoing some growing pains--parking is scarce, the dog situation is kind of out of control, and the garbage problem (for us) has been difficult. I think the apartments are also grossly overpriced. However, maintenance is super on top of things when you call and management is responsive when you email or send them messages. If noise is a concern for you as it has been for us, perhaps an apartment away from the hubbub of everything would be better. We're right next to the clubhouse and the pool and the Alloy is BASICALLY student housing. So you're going to have noise from the pool and clubhouse at all hours of the night, and there's nothing you can do about it except rent a unit further away from where all the students gather to shirk adult responsibility. ;) It's really been a rough year but provided you read your lease carefully, realize what you're getting yourself into, and tack on an additional $200 to the rent they say you'll pay monthly, you'll probably like the Alloy. We're all alive and happy and as we near the end of our lease, that's about what we can hope for. :)
prediction_reason: The review provides a detailed, genuine experience of living at The Alloy apartment complex. The Rock Star drinks were on sale at 3 for $4.00, but the normal price was $1.79. These are frequently on sale at Jewel for $1.00. The regular price for theater-sized candy was $1.49. text:
Highly recommend Beatrix!

We came on a Saturday night for one of my best friends birthday dinner celebration. I strongly recommend making a reservation! To get seated, make sure your party is there. You can make reservations through OpenTable and collect those points!

During the pandemic, they closed â€œw Fulton marketâ€ street and all of the restaurants have outdoor seating and pods available. I thought this was a great idea and itâ€™s going to be so nice for warmer weather nights in the Chi. We did sit inside. All staff did have on mask and hand sanitizer is available. Guests are required to wear masks while in the restaurant, masks are required during all interactions with the service team and only to be removed when eating or drinking. Before seating, all guest did have our temperature checked. They have digital menus and it does say On their menu, to help offset restrictions on their business resulting from the pandemic, there is a a 5% surcharge added to the check. Similar to other restaurants you can let them know if you want it removed.

The ambiance is chic, dimmed lighting and the space is well-decorated. I loved the light fixtures, Iâ€™m weird! The tables were spaced apart, so we didnâ€™t feel as if we were on top of anyone which was nice. The chairs for the round table were ether cushioned or non, all very comfortable.

They had a great selection of beverages and wine list. My friends and I all participated in the restaurant week menu. This is $39 per person and the dinner menu is available daily after 4:00PM. You get to select one of their starters, entrees and dessert, as well as one their cocktails listed. This was such a great deal and I highly recommend to take advantage of it! The portions were perfect for one person or even if you wanted to share so the other guest can order something different too.

In our party, for the starters we tried their hummus which came with a delicious fresh tomatoes and cucumber salad, flavorful hummus and warm naan. I was hesitant about combining the cold tomatoes on top of the hummus/naan, but it was so delicious! We also tried their local burrata with roasted beets and crispy quinoa. I am personally not a beets person, but two of our friends in our party enjoyed it. The only con was, they wanted more of the bread.

For entrees, one of our friends tried their Cavatelli with chicken bolognese and the remaining of our party ordered the skirt steak chimichurri. Both dishes were cooked perfectly and had flavor, they were delicious! The skirt steaks came with fries and grilled shishito peppers. The peppers were a good combo with the steak as they were bit smoky, but they didnâ€™t have spice to them. I do enjoy spice, so I would have liked that, but even so still a delicious combination. The entrees were a good size portion, good to eat alone or again to share (COVID friendly of course).

For dessert, we tried their oh my! Carmel pie, and the pie definitely fits the name. Oh my, oh my, it was fantastic. business_name: The Centre for Oral Surgery in Joliet
text:
This was an absolutely amazing experience!  My oldest son needed 4 impacted molars removed, and I was not pleased with the reviews of the places recommended by his dentist and orthodontist and found this place myself.

They were incredibly thorough in making sure they had all the paperwork, x-rays and other models before the event.  We were given a care package prior to the surgery (something we purchased) to assist in reducing the swelling and to clean the wounds.

We had a meeting prior to the surgery which covered everything that was going to happen with a clear outline of the process, paper work, and billing.

The day itself was so smooth it was amazing.  We arrived a little before the scheduled time, my son was seen around 20 minutes later, and the surgery itself was estimated to be 45 minutes and it was.  We were in an out much quicker than I had expected.  In addition to that, I was able to get all necessary meds at a vending machine (InstyMeds) after the surgery very easily.

My son had a headwrap for the ice packs, we were given extra gauze, chapstick for the  chapped lips that occur during the procedure, extra ice packs, documentation to go home, and even a blanket to take with us!  Anesthesia can give you the shivers so that was an amazing touch.  We received meds for the pain, anti biotics, and meds to help the swelling, which should make this process as pleasant as one can hope to expect.

Our appointment was at 8:40 and I believe we were home before 11!  Very efficient in every detail!  I am totally glad we went with this centre.
prediction_reason: This is a detailed, genuine review describing a specific surgical experience at an oral surgery center. The reviewer provides comprehensive details about their son's impacted molar removal procedure, including pre-surgery preparation, the actual surgery process, post-operative care, and overall satisfaction. The 5-star rating aligns with the highly positive experience described, and the content is directly relevant to the oral surgery services provided by the business.

I live very close to this shop and drive by its location daily; because I noticed the sign on the building from Tonic, I thought to myself, "That's a new sign and I think Tonic is a shisha brand. I'll stop in very soon and check it out!" Stopping in is just what I did!

Upon entering, I noticed many hookahs and hookah accessories lining the wall on the left. Hookahs were set up in the middle of the store on tables and it seems as though you can smoke out of them. I didn't ask the guys working if that was what those particular ones were for because I seriously was more interested in finding a new shisha flavor to try out. I had a nice young man help me and I swear he looks just like the comedian Gabriel Iglesias! Anyways, he helped me and I smelled some recommended flavors. I ended up taking home 100g of Purple Mermaid to try out - if I really like it, next time I'll buy a 200g can. He was also nice enough to show me the Tonic brand hookahs that they have. I truly needed to buy a new hookah to replace my current one that has a rusted stem so I ended up buying a Tribes hookah for $35!!! That's right my friends, $35 for a nice sized hookah! The great thing is, Tonic hookahs come with a year warranty in case something happens to your hookah! Score! There are many more hookah accessories in a smaller room in the back of the store and they carry many brands of natural charcoals like Coco Nara and Coco Mazaya. I love this place so much as a hookah smoker and I've visited only once!

Not only am I a fan, but ummm Twisted.....who??!! Sorry Twisted, but I think I found my new hookah shop to go to regularly and if they start carrying Tangiers shisha, it's over for you guys!!
prediction_reason: The review describes a genuine visit and shopping experience at the hookah/vape shop. The reviewer provides detailed information about their visit, the products they purchased (Purple Mermaid shisha and a Tribes hookah), interactions with staff, and specific observations about the store layout and inventory. The content is highly relevant to the business categories (hookah store, vaporizer store, tobacco shop) and demonstrates authentic customer experience.

I've gone here so many times with my family.

If you went successfully. How did you know, beforehand, that you had to buy tickets? And how did you get them?

We ordered the full rack of Ribs with their homemade BBQ sauce, salad with all the fixings with their homemade Ranch salad dressing, and we substituted the steak fries and Cole slaw for loaded mashed potatoes and vegetable mix. You know how when you go to a restaurant and when you get a salad and they might as well of given you just a head of lettuce? Not here! You get a fresh salad mix with spinach, tomatoes, cheese, onions, cucumber and black oli es. The ribs were juicy with their homemade BBQ sauce, and their loaded mashed potatoes were real!, topped with green onions and cheese. This was the best 25.00 we have ever spent. Julie was also one of the best servers we have come across and she was very knowledgeable about past and current entertainment venues right there at the whiskey barrel. Do not let the empty tables in my pictures fool you. The place is packed in the evening with drink specials definitely to keep you coming back again and again. I was very concerned about contamination (especially with the flash-fry method that may not cook everything completely).
In the sauce area, the plastic shield does not allow enough room to tip the ladles into your bowl, so sauce is spilled everywhere, including into the original sauce containers.

text:
We arrived around 1130. We ordered 2 appetizers ( mozz sticks and spin dip). The apps were good the spin dip came with some soft garlic bread which was good.

We ordered steak with grilled shrimp and eggs with biscuits and gravy with a side of fruit. The fruit came out extremely early (before our apps were finished) and was clearly over ripe and had gone bad. The fruit had hit a fizzy sour phase. The gravy on the biscuits and gravy is canned or just a poor rendition of what sausage gravy should be.  The steak supposed to be med rare came out med well. The shrimp was over cooked to the point of chewy.

Prime rib sandwich with chips, onion rings, garlic mash and with 2 eggs and toast. The potatoes were a boiled potato that had no flavor. The chips were hit and miss raw and flavorless with some full on burnt. The eggs and toast never came.

Biscuits and gravy, eggs and sausage links. The eggs were supposed to be over easy but they were almost over hard. The sausage links never came.

Our empty appetizer plates sat on the table for quite a time. They were not busy. Our drinks often sat empty. Our waitress had a poor attitude and often responded as though we were troublesome for asking for our missing food ( eggs, sausage links and toast). She also slammed our plates onto the table when she was delivering food. We asked twice for our check before we got it. I had to ask twice and argue with the waitress over our check being incorrect as they were still charging us for the food we never received and the fruit which I told her twice that was bad. I ended up having to open a dispute with my banking institution.

The final thought the food was poorly made, over cooked and outright over its good date on some. The service was lackluster and poor. The price given all of these short comings is appallingly high. Our bill was also incorrect and when pointed out I was told that no it was fine it was just out of order.  I wouldnâ€™t recommend stopping in for some food. There is a small diner about 15 minutes down the road that is cheaper with better service.

Skip this stop and head into NewTown for a better meal.
prediction_reason: This is a detailed review describing a genuine dining experience at the restaurant. The reviewer provides specific information about their visit including arrival time, ordered items, food quality issues, service problems, and billing disputes. The 1-star rating is consistent with the numerous negative experiences described, making this a legitimate customer review despite being highly critical.

text: The true test of a good buffet restaurant will be how fresh the food is about an hour to an hour and a half from close.   We arrived approximately an hour from close.   The greeter asks... "you can finish in 45 minutes right?"   Secretly I was giving this man a middle finger,  but we brushed it off and sat down.   It wasnt busy -  just a few tables.   I started off with the "spicy potatoes" and some craw fish.   The spicy potatoes were absolutely the worst thing I've ever had in any restaurant all of my life.   Not fit for human consumption whatsoever.   The craw fish were lukewarm and unimpressive.   I then had some hot and sour soup.   The okra they put in it ruined the taste for me.. It didn't taste like hot and sour soup,  it tasted like okra soup.    I then had some angel hair Asian noodles with peanut chicken and butter chicken.   The noodles were not fresh,  and crusty on the edges -  translation... Sitting out for hours.   The  chicken was alright but cooked very long ago.   I'll spare you the rest of the details but it was simply not fresh food.   They had given up on it long ago.   We complained to the anemic looking gentleman when we left and his excuse was "well,  it is close to closing time".   Hey pal,  don't feed people this garbage.   You're going to get someone sick.   Absolutely horrible buffet and I urge people not to eat here,  especially  near closing time.

text: So beautiful.  Great campgrounds, amazing hiking.Buffalo herd and wild horses, coyotes and prairie dogs. One of my favorite places in the world, with gorgeous sunsets, and clear night skies. There is a long paved road through some of the best parts of the park, if you're unwilling or able to hike long distances. At the campground, firewood is expensive, bring charcoal if you're worried about running out of cooking fire. No electricity in our camping spot, but there is an outlet in the bathroom if you need it. Fire is banned sometimes, to keep us from burning the whole park to the ground (it's arid) and there are great options in Medora for meat eaters (the cowboy cookout is ridiculous and amazing), but vegetarians have limited options, vegans even less. There is a tiny market, and a liquor store with a surprising craft beer selection for how small it is, but both are expensive, as the town is only "open" in the summer, and pretty isolated. Dickinson is probably the closest place with a full sized grocery store.
prediction_reason: The review provides a comprehensive and genuine experience of visiting Theodore Roosevelt National Park, describing specific features like wildlife (buffalo, wild horses, coyotes, prairie dogs), activities (camping, hiking), amenities, and practical information about the area. text:
I went to this location, as another location in town was opening late due to maintenance. We went through the drive through, ordered combos B1, B3, and the donuts and coffee, also a side of nacho cheese (for the potato oles if that wasn't common sense).  We pulled up to the window, and I didn't realize B3 came with soda, so I apologized and asked for coffee instead. She tells me the total which is $14 and some change. When we get our food, I drive off, but realize the bag is pretty light. So I have my daughter look in the bag and realize we only have the 2 burritos and donuts.
I decide to call and make sure that we were supposed to receive potato oles, to which the lady replies "well if you would look at your receipt, it will tell you how it was rung up"  I didn't get a receipt, I didn't think I needed it. She did confirm that B1 and B3 should have come with oles, but the drive through attendant rung them up separate....
Ok so...can we come back to get the oles or will I have to pay more?  (Because $14 for 2 burritos, a cup of donuts, 2 coffees & an orange juice isn't expensive or anything)  She responds with "Um, well, I guess you can get some for the inconvenience"
No apologies or anything, and no explanation as to why she would ring it up like that, when I specifically asked for the combos - I did get the nacho cheese, just no oles.
I won't be going back here.

text:
A fine dining option outside of Bozeman that provides a high level of experienced service. This place is always booked out for at least a month, and we wanted a reservation within the week so ended up taking a 9PM spot. This turned into 9:15, but we didn't care since we were busy chatting with the bartender and enjoying our handcrafted cocktails.

Dinner started with an incredibly knowledgeable server who encouraged menu questions and offered suggestions without being pushy. We ended up getting the fondue, elk bolognese, and fried chicken bucket.

The fondue was devine, and we ate all of it even though we had already eaten plenty of the complimentary bread. The elk bolognese was nice, but I could have done without the housemade pappardelle- it was thick and stuck together, making it tricky to eat. The fried chicken feast was the star of the show- amazing chicken, amazing sides. We left fat and happy.

text: Didnt have the best take out experience today which is odd because I've been coming here since it opened and I love the food.  First off, I called and when the young lady answered she said she had to transfer me to the bar.  Not bad but I thought the bar phone rang when you called in.  She put me on hold, where I stayed for 5 minutes so I hung up, called back and she transfered me again and I put in my order.  When I got in to pick it up I saw a carry out bag sitting at the bar so I went to sit in front of it figuring it was mine.  The bar tender, a tall slender caucasian guy caught eye contact with me, walked around to the other side of the bar, poured some water, then walked back and was like "Oh I didnt even hear you come in".  As if the direct eye contact he gave me when I came in wasnt enough for him to know I was there, I was also wearing loud cowboy boots and it wasnt hardly anyone in the restaurant.  The only person who wouldnt have noticed me come in wouldve been someone blind and deaf.    Some other young ladies came over to the bar and he told them to check the order to make sure it was mine...  What was wrong with him making sure it was mine.  He was literally doing nothing.  I sensed it was some tense energy in there surrounding this guy because the other young ladies had frustrated looks on their faces.  I paid for my food and left and as I was walking away he loudly and sarcastically greated someone else.  I had my food at that point but did want to make sure I set aside time to write this review because whatever is going on with the guy at the bar today, tall slender caucasian guy, he seems to be rubbing everyone, including me, a paying customer, the wrong way.  The food is always good, I wouldve given 5 stars otherwise.  I'll make sure not to come in for a while so hopefully I'm not "served/helped" by that guy next time I come in.  My visit was around 4pm 4/20/2019

text: I used to live in NY, and this restaurant quickly became an all time favorite. I then moved to Texas and a few years later found this location in Austin. I was so excited as I missed the incredible food, deserts, and service I experienced in NY. However I became quickly disappointed. The food was still decencompared to other restaurants and the service wasn't awful, compared to other restaurants. But neither are what I have known and come to expect from a Grand Lux. This place is rather pricey. It's one of those places you go to treat yourself or small family once in a very blue moon. However the quality of food and level of service were not worth the price from this experience. Myself, husband, and best friend went together as I wanted to bring them to the amazing restaurant I knew in NY. We were quickly seated. However the decor was outdated and felt as if we were sitting in one of those hotel restaurants where not much thought is given to decor because the restaurant is really there out of convenience. My friend and I ordered brunch drinks. The drinks themselves tasted decent but not $10-$11 dollars a glass decent and they were very very small. The bloody Mary was served in a rather small glass with tons of ice. Mine was served in a small champagne glass. Neither had any traceable amounts of alcohol in them... like I said, they were tasty, but not worth the gouged price. Our waiter quickly checked back in to see if we were ready to order. We ordered but that was the last we saw of him until the end of the meal. Three separate people delivered our food at different times. We were never prompted or asked about desert when our order was taken. This place makes several things to order and take roughly 30 minutes, so your waiter needs to put in the order at the beginning. Let me tell you, the desserts from Grand Lux are to die for, but we were never asked or able.to order them, so I can only speak from my experience at the NY location. My friend ordered the lunch omelet with a side salad. It came out with hash browns and no salad. The waitress delivering it quickly apologized and took it back for her. However another 15-20 minutes went by before it came back out. I shared my Asian tacos from the tapas menu while we waited. They were yummy. I also ordered mini crab cakes (my husband's favorite) and tuna ceviche but was told after the fact they were out of the ceviche. Which was okay ultimately, as I became full very quickly, but it would have been helpful if my waiter was aware of any menu changes in the beginning. My husband ordered butter garlic shrimp pasta. The sauce was good but the shrimp weren't cleaned properly. They had sand in them, were gritty, and not deveined. We finally saw our waiter again once we were finished. He offered to box our food up to go which we said yes. My tacos and crab cakes were both supposed to have sauce. At the NY restaurant I go to they always included an extra to go cup of whatever sauce your food came with. This waiter did not. The food was good but the sauce definitely doesn't all together as it should with any decent meal. Like I said, it would have been good if I were going to a restaurant like cheddars. However this is the Grand Lux. For our simple meal for three people (and my two very small plates coming from a tapas menu), our bill was well over $100. This is not the type of food or experience I would expect for the name or the price and I am highly disappointed. To add insult to injury the food made me, my friend and husband very sick that night. It was the only thing we ate all day and the only meal we have ever had in common in over a month. My friend lives in Austin and I live by Fort Hood. So there is no way and highly unlikely it camfrom something else we ate. I would highly doubt the possibility of me ever returning here. I guess I will have to wait on the rare trip if ever, I go back to NY to visit a Grand Lux again.
prediction_reason: This is a detailed, genuine review of a dining experience at Grand Lux Cafe. The reviewer describes specific aspects of their visit including food quality, service, pricing, and atmosphere. Despite the 1-star rating and negative tone, the review provides substantial detail about an actual visit and compares it to their previous experiences at other locations. The content is highly relevant to the restaurant and shares a legitimate customer experience.
description: Upmarket chain offering a wide-ranging American menu in opulent surroundings.

text: I am extremely frustrated with the Geek Squad service I have received.  I took my computer in on July 29.  I was told they would have to send the computer off to a service center for repairs, so I should come in to back it up.  I went the next day to back up my computer to be told it had already been shipped off.  When I hadn't heard anything on the tracking, I called to find out that my computer had NOT been sent off but was still in the store.  I asked about the backup, and I was told they had done one.  My computer left the store 14 days after I took it in because they "didn't have shipping boxes available."  The service center did not receive my computer for 9 more days. The diagnosis was made 15 days later. The repairs were made and the computer was shipped 7 days later and was ready for pick up 5 days after that.  When I picked up my computer, they had not uploaded the back up and said they would need it another day. The backup was supposedly done, and I picked up the computer.  It has NOTHING on it. text:
Barracuda Tacos is great! We have been enjoying their taco selection since they opened. I am a vegetarian but love Tacos. Barracuda offers two unique, flavorful, and nicely spicy vegetarian tacos which many places struggle with outside of Texas and California. They have AWESOME salsa and a jar of the salsa matcha is a most for the home pantry.
-
Also, I've read some of the reviews and think there is some confusion regarding operations. The outdoor eat-in dining experience is very casual and laid back. The seating is first come first serve, seat yourself tables. Pre pandemic sometimes you'd have to share a community table with usually cool strangers because they were so busy in the summer. The utensils and napkins are self serve. Drinks from large parties are often self pick up at the drink window. There are not traditional servers who cater to individual guests and tables. They are more like helpful friendly food runners.

text:
So torn.

On the one hand, the guy who came by afterwards and repaired some of the minor damage was great. On the other hand, the moving experience itself was horrible.

I had a 3 bed 1 bath house moving to a 3 bed 2 bath house. I had 2 bedroom sets, an office, a full living room, 15 boxes, 10 bags, and 3 appliances to move. The distance between locations was under 2 miles. We were quoted 4-5hrs.

The last moving company I hired did a move from baton rouge to Denham with the same contents in under 4hrs with travel time.

The two men that turned up dragged their feet every opportunity they could. They kept closing the truck wanting to move to the 2nd house when the 1st house still had contents to be moved. They kept taking on-the-clock breaks. They kept losing hardware for disassembled furniture.

I literally had to keep stating "everything but the fridge and oven needs to be on the truck" but they still failed to load up all of the soft materials, appliances, etc, on the first trip. They packed so stupidly they had to make 2 trips.

On the first trip, to the new location, they left the same time as me and somehow took an additional 15 minutes driving the 1 mile to the new house. They forgot the bed hardware at the old house. After unloading the truck, I had to send they put the furniture where I asked them to put it and not just drop it in the center of the room.

I then had to bribe them to make a 2nd trip to retrieve the 10 bags, 2 missed appliances, and a bunch of other small items. Again, I had to keep reminding them I'm paying for their time and I needed everything moved, everything. They kept closing the truck, again. They kept walking past items, stating rooms were empty when plastic crates and PCs were sitting in the middle of the floor. 6hrs after the move started, I finally managed to get nearly everything into the new house.

Of course, we went back and retrieved stuff like the dryer vent line, the microwave, two more boxes, and two baskets with electronics that were missed on both the first and second trip.

The manager who turned up 3 days after the move apologized for the men, and repaired some of the damages. He cut a check for $165 to offset damages to a coffee table that looked like the guys used as a dance floor.

Today, I finally had a reason to start looking at hanging my 55" 4k Samsung TV. To my horror, I just found not one, but 3 decent scratches on the glass. Here's hoping 2 men and a truck can cover those damages too.u

Edit: damage guy hasn't returned 5 calls and check for damages never arrived.
prediction_reason: This is a detailed, genuine review describing a specific moving experience with Two Men and a Truck. Planet Fitness is a pretty straight-forward operation.  You pay a low monthly fee, and a reasonable annual fee, and you get access to some really great equipment, weights, and a clean environment 24/7. text:
Update: 4 years and another lazy, half-hearted remodel later, I still keep wishing this chain would just fold and be replaced by any other theater chain. Still the same cruddy screens and terrible sound. Now with reclining seats in maybe half the theaters! Yay.

Original review:
This location underwent a lackluster, half-hearted remodel (the chairs are nice, the colors are not) that failed to replace aged, stained and otherwise damaged screens. The audio in most of the theaters substitutes volume for a quality and fidelity that is sorely lacking. Following the remodel, the size of the popcorn containers was reduced considerably while the price was most decidedly not, and the quality seems to have declined as well (this coming from a movie theater popcorn junkie). The Grand 16 makes me wish for another chain to come to town every time I attend. Their monopoly on Lafayette cinema had allowed them to get away with a steady decline in every measure of quality and, frankly, I see far more movies for the first time on Vudu or Blu-ray now as a result.
prediction_reason: The review provides a detailed and genuine experience about visiting this movie theater location. The reviewer discusses specific aspects like screens, sound quality, seating, popcorn, and facility remodels - all directly relevant to the movie theater business. Despite the negative sentiment and 2-star rating, this represents a legitimate customer experience and feedback about the theater's services and facilities.

text: I tried reaching out to mall management with a complaint about one of the kiosk vendors today but the form on their website isn't working and they don't have a contact email, so I'll put it here instead. Early today, while walking through this mall, I had an off-putting experience with one of the kiosk vendors that I felt I should make known to mall management. I was walking past the Deep Sea Cosmetic kiosk, when the vendor grabbed me by the hand, turned me around and placed a sample product into my hand. He did not ask me or even address me at any point before this. HE DIDN'T EVEN SPEAK TO ME BEFORE TOUCHING ME. He just grabbed me (while I was walking alone through the mall), put the loose product into my hand (despite my raising concerns about allergens because I have severe topical allergies to many products). He then steered me over to the kiosk. He offered to do a demonstration with the product and I declined. At this point, he directed me to put my hands over a bowl so he could remove the product he had put there. Once I was there, he proceeded with the demonstration anyway. He would not listen to my repeated refusal or my questions about allergies. After drying my hands off, he proceeded to ring me up for products that I had not asked for and had refused many times--MORE THAN $100 IN PRODUCT THAT I HAD OUTRIGHT REFUSES. I continued to refuse and--after attempting to persuade me by lowering the price--he then slammed the register closed and began to make rude comments about my clothes and appearance. The experience made me extremely uncomfortable, and I feel this goes beyond the line of just a pushy salesman. There is no reason that salesman should be grabbing women--by their hand or otherwise--as they are walking alone through the mall. I clearly refused the demonstration and the product MANY times (to the extent that a salesperson at another kiosk nearby ended up interceding and asking the man to leave me alone) but he persisted. My hands are now very irritated and sore. Fortunately, the reactions I have are normally only topical, but that may not have been the case for someone else.
prediction_reason: This is a detailed, genuine review describing a specific negative experience at Jefferson Mall involving a kiosk vendor.
